title: issue: Build failure after auto-updating to 7.56.0: Can't import named exports like useEffect/useRef
body:
### Version Number

7.56.0

### Codesandbox/Expo snack

N/A

### Steps to reproduce

1. package.json had "react-hook-form": "^7.54.2".

2. After running npm install or yarn install, the package auto-updated to 7.56.0.

3. Attempted to build the project (e.g., with Webpack).

4. The following errors appeared during the build:
`Can't import the named export 'useEffect' from non EcmaScript module (only default export is available)
Can't import the named export 'useRef' from non EcmaScript module (only default export is available)`



A similar issue was previously reported [here](https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/issues/10465).

Following the suggested workaround from that issue (locking the version without a caret ^) resolved the problem.

It seems that the issue was introduced in 7.56.0.

### Expected behaviour

The project should build successfully.

Named exports like useEffect and useRef should be properly imported without errors.

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

_No response_

### Relevant log output

```shell
[vite] Internal server error: Can't import the named export 'useEffect' from non EcmaScript module (only default export is available)
[vite] Internal server error: Can't import the named export 'useRef' from non EcmaScript module (only default export is available)
```

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
